result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandyn Joseph Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs of $579.00 - No contact with Diane Matthews unless DOC approves of the contact -  credit for 2 days time served - eligible for expunction automatically if successfully completes probation and at the age of 20 - submit DNA Sample

miscConds.notes: Fine $379.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $200.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Brandyn Joseph Matthews in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court amends to straight DC and deletes the enhancer.   DE entered plea of NC.   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court finds defendant guilty.

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs of $579.00 - No contact with Diane Matthews unless DOC approves of the contact -  credit for 2 days time served - eligible for expunction automatically if successfully completes probation and at the age of 20 - submit DNA Sample

Defendant Brandyn Joseph Matthews in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Counsel enters NG Plea.  Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appeared in custody via video.  State appeared by Atty Marcoux.  SIBS $1000.00 - No contact with Diane Matthews or her residence.
No contact directly or indirectly with Diane Matthews and no contact with her residence.
